Posts.EditableText:
Try this ASL (I'm not a fan of slashes in front of commands by the way...):

[code:324k0dub]
command </who> for each object in game if property <#quest.thing#; netplayer> then msg <#@quest.thing#>
[/code:324k0dub]

That should just print a straight list of players. Obviously you can make it more complicated and add fancy formatting if you like.

For players to type some text to say to everybody in the room, just put a quote character in front of it. This is covered in the Quest help file under Playing Games > Multi-Player Games.

Do you have the IRC-style option on in Quest? If you do then making the command "/who" means you'd have to type "//who" to get it to work - another reason I don't like forcing slashes at the beginning of commands.

Change the command to "who" and see if that works when you type "/who" when playing in Quest.
